meanings.definition: To make or become less deep.
meanings.sent1: The river was shallowing, making it easier to cross.
meanings.sent2: The pool is shallowing as the water evaporates.
meanings.sent3: The kids were playing in the shallowing water, splashing around joyfully.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in the topic was shallowing, like a puddle drying up in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The boat struggled through the shallowing waters, barely making progress.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming less deep.
meanings.sent1: The shallowing of the lake was noticeable after the dry season.
meanings.sent2: He observed the gradual shallowing of the pond over the years.
meanings.sent3: The shallowing of the conversation left them with nothing more to discuss.
meanings.sent4: The shallowing of her emotions made her feel distant from others.
meanings.sent5: The shallowing of the canyon revealed layers of rock that were hidden before.
